org.jsfml.audio

Class SoundSource

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jsfml.internal.SFMLNativeObject
      • org.jsfml.audio.SoundSource
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Sound, SoundStream

    public abstract class SoundSource
extends SFMLNativeObject
    Abstract base class for playable sound sources.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SoundSource

        public SoundSource()
        Constructs a sound source.

    • Method Detail

      • setPitch

        public void setPitch(float pitch)
        Sets the pitch factor of the sound.

        This factor is used to scale the sound's original pitch. This means that the default value of 1 will not affect the pitch at all. Values between 0 and 1 will pitch down the sound, while values greater than 1 will pitch it up.

        Parameters:
        pitch - the new pitch factor of the sound.

      • setVolume

        public void setVolume(float volume)
        Sets the volume of the sound.

        The sound volume is a percentages and ranges between 0 (silence) and 100 (full volume). The default volume of a sound is 100.

        Parameters:
        volume - the new volume of the sound, ranging between 0 and 100.

      • setPosition

        public final void setPosition(float x,
               float y,
               float z)
        Sets the position of the sound in the scene.

        This allows for sound spatialization, also involving the Listener. The sound position is set either absolutely in the scene or relatively to the Listener, depending on whether isRelativeToListener() is true or false.

        By default, a sound is located at the origin (0, 0, 0).

        Note that only mono sounds (ie 1 audio channel) can be spatialized.

        Parameters:
        x - the sound's new X coordinate.
        y - the sound's new Y coordinate.
        z - the sound's new Z coordinate.
        See Also:
        setRelativeToListener(boolean)

      • setPosition

        public void setPosition(Vector3f v)
        Sets the position of the sound in the scene.

        This allows for sound spatialization, also involving the Listener. The sound position is set either absolutely in the scene or relatively to the Listener, depending on whether isRelativeToListener() is true or false.

        By default, a sound is located at the origin (0, 0, 0).

        Note that only mono sounds (ie 1 audio channel) can be spatialized.

        Parameters:
        v - the sound's new position.
        See Also:
        setRelativeToListener(boolean)

      • setRelativeToListener

        public void setRelativeToListener(boolean relative)
        Determines whether the sound position is bound to be relative to the Listener or whether it is positioned absolutely in the scene.

        By default, the sound's position in the scene is absolute.

        Parameters:
        relative - true to make the sound position relative to the listener, false to make it absolute.
        See Also:
        setPosition(float, float, float)

      • setMinDistance

        public void setMinDistance(float distance)
        Sets the minimum distance of the sound before attenuation kicks in.

        If the distance between the sound and the Listener is less or equal to this value, the sound will be heard at its maximum volume. As the distance becomes larger, the sound is attenuated (ie become more quiet) according to its attenuation factor.

        The default minimum distance is 1.

        Parameters:
        distance - the minimum distance before attenuation in world units.
        See Also:
        setAttenuation(float)

      • setAttenuation

        public void setAttenuation(float att)
        Sets the sound's attenuation factor.

        As the distance between the sound and the Listener becomes higher than the minimum distance, the sound volume will decrease according to this factor.

        The attenuation factor ranges between 0 (no attenuation) and 100 (instant attenuation), where the default value is 1.

        Parameters:
        att - the new attenuation factor, ranging between 0 (no attenuation) and 100 (instant attenuation).
        See Also:
        setMinDistance(float)

      • getPitch

        public float getPitch()
        Gets the sound's current pitch factor.

        A value of 1 means that the sound is not pitched, a value between 0 and 1 means that the sound is pitched down, a value greater than 1 means that the sound is pitched up.

        Returns:
        the sound's current pitch factor.

      • getVolume

        public float getVolume()
        Gets the sound's current volume.

        The volume level ranges between 0 (silence) and 100 (full volume).

        Returns:
        the sound's current volume, ranging between 0 (silence) and 100 (full volume).

      • getPosition

        public Vector3f getPosition()
        Gets the sound's current position in the scene.
        Returns:
        the sound's current position in the scene.

      • isRelativeToListener

        public boolean isRelativeToListener()
        Returns whether the sound's position is relative to the Listener.
        Returns:
        true if the sound's position is relative to the listener, false if it is absolute.
        See Also:
        setRelativeToListener(boolean)

      • getMinDistance

        public float getMinDistance()
        Gets the sound's minimum distance from the Listener before attenuation sets in.
        Returns:
        the sound's minimum distance before attenuation sets in.
        See Also:
        setMinDistance(float)

      • getAttenuation

        public float getAttenuation()
        Gets the sound's attenuation factor.

        The attenuation factor ranges between 0 (no attenuation) and 100 (instant attenuation), where the default value is 1.

        Returns:
        the sound's attenuation factor.
        See Also:
        setAttenuation(float)
